Posts.Content: Hello, I am a Swedish woman, who due to very dense breasts, nipple discharge, and great imaging/biopsy difficulties with newly found mass, have been offered to do PBM. I will start with one breast, asap. My mom died in brain tumor, and my hubby doesnt really understand, so I find it difficult asking a buddy to travel from Europe to USA, as a support person is required by the surgeons., day after surgery. Having removed an ovarian tumor/hysterectomy , I feel fine on my own. Are there any volunteer groups I can contact in USA. Best wishes.
Posts.Title: Scandinavian lady,47yrs, PBM surgery, volunteer?....

Posts.Content: Hi, I am already into the alternative path you described. Thanks!
Posts.Title: Scandinavian lady,47yrs, PBM surgery, volunteer?....

Posts.Content: Hi, I am a supportive lady, who reads alot of research. I am travelling to MD Andersson Houston, 03.00 Sunday, a win and loose thing, due to ruptured ovarian tumor and scattered multiple fibroadenomas that just have popped up. Dense breasts. Wish to take the whole breast away, due to many symptoms. Looking for a friend,  take care, Ann
Posts.Title: Swedish lady, 46yrs old, are you at the MD Andersson?

Posts.Content: Hi, I am a positive 46 yr old Swedish lady, who has multipel small fibros that just have popped up im my dense breasts. Strong pain. I have lesions popping up in my liver, livertumorconference diagnosis. I am going to take away my right breast, as I  had previous CA125, ovarytumor. Going to MD Andersson.    What is your experience? Ann
Posts.Title: Dense breasts, liver lesions, ? and fibros
